results.title: Terrorism
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “State of the Nation Bounds of Freedom”.
A known terrorist invites a television producer to interview him in another country and without revealing his whereabouts to the police. Can such an interview be screened and should the police be informed Moderated by Benno Schmidt.

results.title: Terror in the aisles
results.creator_credit: Kaleidoscope Films, Stephen Netburn and Andrew J Kuehn
results.brief_description: With excerpts from over fifty films from the horror genre, “Terror in the aisles” delivers a fast paced montage of some of the most terrifying scenes in cinema from the best of the horror genre. This collection is not for the faint-hearted but will satisfy the horror buff as some of the most classic scenes from the genre are revisited here. Some excerpts include: “The Exorcist”, “Psycho”, “Carrie”, “Shining”, “Rosemary’s baby”, “The Howling”, “Eyes of Laura Mars”, “Midnight express”, “Halloween”, “The Birds”, “Suspiria”, “Marathon man”, “Jaws”, “The Texas chainsaw massacre”, “Poltergeist”, “The Fog”, “Scanners and many more. Narrated by Donald Pleasence and Nancy Allen.

results.title: Terror by night
results.creator_credit: Universal Studios and Roy William Neill
results.brief_description: Sherlock Holmes and Watson find themselves aboard the London-Edinburgh Express, guarding the priceless “Star of Rhodesia” diamond. A series of murders leads them on a trail confused by disguise and impersonation. Starring Basil Rathbone and Nigel Bruce. Adapted from a story by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle.

results.title: Territorial rights
results.creator_credit: Ian Woolf, Tony Matthews and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Interaction”.
Part 7 of a series of films for managers. Examines the reasons why so many misunderstandings occur between specialists and the “line” managers they advise. A film of an argument between a production manager and a services engineer is used as the basis for a discussion between personnel, finance and works managers, and consultants on the sources of interdepartmental problems. Introduced by Brian Redhead.

results.title: Terra Nullius
results.creator_credit: Alison Wotherspoon, AFTRS and Anne Pratten
results.brief_description: Loosely based on the filmmaker’s personal experience, “Terra Nullius” is an impressionistic account of an eight year old Koori girl, Alice, growing up in a white adoptive family which denies her Aboriginality. The film examines how unacknowledged shame and fear passes from one generation to the next, from one culture to another. The last scene depicts a silent meeting between the young Alice and the adult Alice. In order to reclaim her life, Alice decides she must confront the pain and confusion of her childhood.

results.title: Terra nova
results.creator_credit: Fernand Dansereau, ONF | NFB and Roger Blais
results.brief_description: Among these lively impressions of Newfoundland today, coloured by history and by the sea, there are scenes of historic events, fishing on the high seas and squid jigging inshore, mining deep underground, and operations of the giant pulp and paper industry. (Award: Los Angeles.)

results.title: Terra firma
results.brief_description:
This cut-out animation started life as a 5-metre long conte drawing inspired by the various unseen energies that influence and create a dimension.
Original music by Steve Fraser, Dennis Phelan, Luke Von Banbergern. Animation by Julian lawrence.

results.title: Termite colony: a complex social organization
results.brief_description: A discussion of the polymorphic social organisation within an African termite colony, describing the unique roles of the queen, soldiers, and workers in the colony. Shows the care for the queen during the egg laying stage and the care for the young after the eggs hatch; the cultivation of a food supply for the colony; the defence of the colony by the soldiers; and the repair of the nest by the workers.

results.title: Terminus
results.creator_credit: Edgar H. Anstey, British Transport Films and John Schlesinger
results.brief_description: Impressions by John Schlesinger of a day in one London’s main railway stations - told with music, songs and half-hearted commentary. A historically significant account of Waterloo Station which has altered greatly to accommodate the Channel Tunnel trains. Music by Ron Grains. (Awards: British Film Academy Award - Best Documentary, Venice Golden Lion Awards)

results.title: Terminator 2: judgement day
results.creator_credit: Pacific Western, Lightstorm Entertainment and James Cameron
results.brief_description: Sequel to “Terminator”. The story resumes several years later in present day Los Angeles. A cybernetic assassin and bodyguard are sent back from the future. This time the target is John Connor (Edward Furlong), Sarah’s son. The story revolves around the conflict between two Terminators over the the boy’s life and ultimately the future of the human race. Arnold Schwarzenegger and Robert Patrick are suitably impressive and menacing as the two cyborgs, but in the words of James Cameron, the “real” terminator is Linda Hamilton as Sarah Connor. Her transformation from desperate prey, in the original film, to vigilante guerilla is rivetting. At the time of its release, “Terminator 2: Judgement Day” was the most expensive film ever made at a cost of $100 million. Fans of action adventure, mind-boggling special effects and wanton destruction will not be disappointed.
